fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.closeImg(image, sz=3, it=1)¶
fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.crop_perspective(img, config: AnalyzerConfig)¶

Crops a given image to its containing pane bounds. Finds smallest pane countour with 4 corner points and aligns, rotates and scales the pane to fit a resulting image.

Parameters:

  • img (Image) – Input image with a clearly visible glass pane.

  • size (int) – Size of the resulting image after perspective transformation.

  • dbg (bool) – Displays debug image outputs during processing.

Returns:

A cropped image which only contains the glass pane. Size: 1000x1000.

If no 4 point contour is found, the whole image is returned.

Return type:

img

fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.detect_fragments(binary_image, config: AnalyzerConfig) → list[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]]¶

fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.isgray(img)¶
fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.plotImage(img, title: str, color: bool = True, region: tuple[int, int, int, int] | None = None)¶
fracsuite.splinters.analyzer.preprocess_image(image, config: AnalyzerConfig) → _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]¶

Preprocess a raw image.

Parameters:

  • image (nd.array) – The input image.

  • gauss_sz (size-tuple, optional) – The size of the gaussian filter. Defaults to (5,5).

  • gauss_sig (int, optional) – The sigma for gaussian filter. Defaults to 3.

  • block_size (int, optional) – Block size of adaptive threshold. Defaults to 11.

  • C (int, optional) – Sensitivity of adaptive threshold. Defaults to 6.

  • rsz (int, optional) – Resize factor for the image. Defaults to 1.

Returns:

Preprocessed image.

Return type:

np.array

A random color.

Return type:

(r,g,b)

fracsuite.splinters.splinter module¶

class fracsuite.splinters.splinter.Splinter(contour, index, mm_px: float)¶

Bases: object

calculate_roughness() → float¶

Calculate the roughness of the contour by comparing the circumfence of the contour to the circumfence of its convex hull.

Returns:

A value indicating how rough the perimeter is.

Return type:

float
